episodes.title: Black Girls Talking - BGT Episode 69: ATLANTA
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Alesia is joined by some equally rude friends to discuss Donald Glover's new show Atlanta, the current state of Black folks on tv, the Black love we deserve and a lot more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 68: Pastel Goth & Self-Care With Erika Paget & Darice Murphy
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In this episode Ramou announces a special project with her special guests, Darice fan girls, and Erika tells us about that time peeing her pants led to self-love.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 67: This Woman's Work, with Nemat and Elelta
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Fatima is joined by Elelta and Nemat of the podcast Kaleidoscope Sounds to talk about working, not working, $ management, mentoring, running away to a commune and more.

episodes.title: Black Girls Talking Episode 66: Knickers & Bed Jackets with The Lingerie Addict, Cora Harrington
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Join Ramou as she sits down with The Lingerie Addict herself, Cora Harrington, to chat about knickers, bed jackets, the significance of lingerie within the fashion industry and why we need to have more conversations about all of it.

episodes.title: Black Girls Talking Episode 65: Alexis Wilkinson Returns!
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Former BGT guest and college graduate Alexis Wilkinson is back and she's here to discuss Snapchat, the dangers of giving out your phone number, and the perfect Brussels sprout.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 64: F@#$ Your Exposure - Fatima chats with Riya Jama
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Fatima and artist Riya Jama chat about impostor syndrome, stanning for Black girls, knowing your worth, the artist struggle, internet trolls and more. TW for talk of sexual violence.

episodes.title: #DISABILITYTOOWHITE: On Disability and Representation
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Fatima, Krystal and Vilissa get into representations of people with disabilities in media, beginning with the new film Me Before You, and discuss #DISABILITYTOOWHITE, the GOAT Muhammad Ali and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 62: #BEAUTYCHAT with Essence Beauty Box Editors Julee Wilson & Pamela Christiani
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
In this edition of #Beautychat we sit down with Julee Wilson (twitter.com/MissJulee) and Pamela Christiani (twitter.com/PECStyle) to chat about Essence Beauty Box. We get all the details on Essence Beauty Box and get into the importance of supporting Black beauty brands, finding a signature fragrance, what the world of beauty is missing and the Kultural Appropriation Kardashians. Sit back, drink some water and have a listen. Also please wash your face tonight. 

References
Essence Beauty Box http://essencebeautybox.com/essence/beautybox/
What's your shade of beautiful? http://essence.socialtyze.com/?iframe=1
MDM http://www.mdmflow.com/
Scotch Porter http://scotchporter.com/
Bevel https://getbevel.com/?gclid=CNOHssmB3s0CFZNafgodw1QOfw
Taliah Waajid http://www.naturalhair.org/
Hair Rules http://hairrules.com/

episodes.title: BGT Episode 61: Lisa & Amy & Ramou Are Black
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In this episode, Ramou is joined by comedy writers Lisa McQuillan and Amy Aniobi, the brilliant and hilarious minds behind the web series "Lisa And Amy Are Black" and writers from "blackish" (Lisa) and the long-anticipated Issa Rae HBO show, "Insecure" (Amy). Listen in as Ramou lies back on the therapy couch while Lisa and Amy talk having the confidence to release your inner creative, quickly transition into why craft services is heaven on earth, and end with the quest for hardwood floors.

episodes.title: Episode 60: 2 Fast Car 2 Furious: Aurelia chats with Jenn Mundia
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
In this episode Aurelia chats with her friend; NYC based singer-songwriter and self proclaimed Tinder queen, Jenn Mundia. They run down topics like: making it in the music business, Kenyan home cooking, and what its like as a Black girl acoustic artist in a post Tracy Chapman world. 

You can check out Jenn's new album "Heads or Tails" as well as the rest of her discography and schedule of live performances at: https://www.facebook.com/jennmundiamusic/

episodes.title: Bonus Episode #16: Writer's Roundtable With Stacia Brown & Jessica Tholmer
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Cozy on up to the Writer's Roundtable in this episode as Ramou is joined by Stacia Brown (The Washington Post, Vulture) and Jessica Tholmer (HelloGiggles, Wisdom Times). The three talk balancing a writing schedule with those pesky things called DAY JOBS and CHILDREN and LIFE, the phenomenon of the response piece, and how to push through writer's fatigue.

episodes.title: Bonus Episode #15: Hold On To Your Dreams: Aurelia Chats With Yolanda Rabun
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Get ready to get "Inside The #Blacktor's Studio" again as Aurelia chats with Actor's Equity member, recording artist, corporate lawyer, mom and general renaissance woman: Yolanda Rabun (http://www.yolandarabun.com/). They talk about what it means to be successful, the very un-glamorous life of a performing artist, and how to rise to the top without falling off a cliff.

episodes.title: Bonus Episode 14 - Beymergency: LEMONADE
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: #LEMONADE

episodes.title: BGT EPISODE 59: Wellness is the Wave
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
We're talking Wellness: ways we're taking care of ourselves and ways we want to take care of ourselves - including floating in tanks full of salt water and yoga with pop stars who have questionable hair. We also imagine our dream wellness retreat and discuss why alternative medicine is poppin.

References:
Into the Void, Learning Mindfulness From Floating: http://www.racked.com/2016/3/22/11062510/float-spa-mindfullness
https://www.instagram.com/foodheavenshow 
Breeze Harper http://www.sistahvegan.com 
Bryant Terry's book: http://www.bryant-terry.com/books/ 
Black Girl in Om: http://www.blackgirlinom.com/
Hey Fran Hey: https://www.youtube.com/user/heyfranhey
Jessamyn Stanley: https://www.instagram.com/mynameisjessamyn

episodes.title: BGT EPISODE 58: LIVE FROM AUSTIN ft Austin While Black
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
We had our first live show during SXSW and were super excited to be joined by Evelyn and Doyin from Austin While Black. We had a very spirited and inspiring conversation on everything from dating to building community. Endless hugs and gratitude to everyone who shared this space with us! 

Austin While Black: http://www.austinwhileblack.com/

episodes.title: BONUS EPISODE 13: Phife Forever
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Ayyyy in this bonus ep Fatima and Alesia are joined by fellow rap nerds, Danielle and Yodith, to pay homage to Phife and discuss the impact A Tribe Called Quest had on all of us.

episodes.title: BONUS EPISODE 12: A CPT Movie Review - Dope
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
Dope is on Netflix so we finally watched it and had a lot of things to say about representation, multifaceted depictions of Black life and when it's time to GROW UP.

Black Women Directors: http://www.blackwomendirectors.co/

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Episode 11: Growing Pains
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In this bonus episode Aurelia, Ramou and Fatima discuss getting older; getting lost in the desert; getting eaten by coyotes; and getting into The People vs. OJ Simpson.

episodes.title: BGT EPISODE 57: Imposter Syndrome
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
We talk about Imposter Syndrome, what we've earned and why we're afraid to ask for what we deserve. But first: BIEBER WATCH, THE FORMATION TOUR, The Malcolm X of cornrows and some other stuff (a lot of stuff).

References:
Biebz for GQ: http://www.gq.com/story/justin-bieber-gq-interview
We Slay, Part I: http://newsouthnegress.com/southernslayings/
In Beyoncé's 'Formation,' A Glorification Of 'Bama' Blackness: http://www.npr.org/sections/codeswitch/2016/02/10/466178725/in-beyonc-s-formation-a-song-for-the-bama
Black Lives Matter Co-Founder to Beyonce: 'Welcome to the Movement': http://www.rollingstone.com/culture/news/black-lives-matter-co-founder-to-beyonce-welcome-to-the-movement-20160211#ixzz40PCCkV3E
"The Day Beyoncé Turned Black": https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ociMBfkDG1w
13 Charts That Will Make Total Sense To People With Impostor Syndrome: http://www.buzzfeed.com/kristinchirico/13-charts-that-will-make-total-sense-to-people-with-impostor#.vumwvRxmM
We Are Being Set Up To Fail — & It Should Make You Mad As Hell: http://www.refinery29.com/imposter-syndrome-and-women
If You Have Imposter Syndrome, Don’t Tell People What To Do, Tell Them What Works: http://lifehacker.com/if-you-have-imposter-syndrome-don-t-tell-people-what-t-1756056084

episodes.title: BGT EPISODE 56: Take a nap, Kanye.
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
We're discussing the 24 hour moving train wreck that is Kanye and the Kardashians - for the last time, Beyonce willing. Also on the docket: Blac Chyna the chess master,  Birth of a Nation and why we need more movies about American history with black folks at the helm, an update on that awful Straight Outta Compton casting call and a beautiful moment in shade history courtesy of Gabrielle Union.

Updates: 
We're nominated for a Shorty Award! You can vote daily until February 11th: http://shortyawards.com/8th/blkgirlstalking
Check us out on Patron: https://www.patreon.com/blackgirlstalking?ty=h
Sign up for our Tiny Letter: http://tinyletter.com/blackgirlstalking

References:
Kanye West Viciously Attacks Wiz Khalifa in Incredible Twitter Rant: http://pitchfork.com/news/63189-kanye-west-viciously-attacks-wiz-khalifa-in-incredible-twitter-rant/

Kanye answers question on accountability to black women within the context of his music (starts at 1:28:00): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fYwiR1kA7gI
Why I’m Ready for More Slavery Films: http://www.thenation.com/article/why-im-ready-for-more-slavery-films/
BGT discussion on the Straight Outta Compton casting call: https://www.spreaker.com/user/blackgirlstalking/black-girls-talking-episode-32
Gabrielle Union on Dionne not Warwick: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=50pmRM2rfMM

episodes.title: BGT Episode 55: Tinder &Taraji
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
Happy New Year! We're back at it discussing, well, EVERYTHING. Tinder, Taraji: High Priestess of Shade, sausages, bears. We also weigh in on the Globes, Black Girl Magic and Oprah. Join us!

But before you do...

Would you mind voting for your girls?! We were nominated for a Shorty award for best podcast! You can vote once a day until Feb 18th. --> http://shortyawards.com/8th/blkgirlstalking

Also! Have you subscribed to our TinyLetter? Please do!
--> http://tinyletter.com/blackgirlstalking

episodes.title: BONUS EPISODE 10: Inside The Blacktor's Studio with Andrea Lewis
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're digging into the archives this week to bring you our very first edition of Inside The Blacktor's Studio; a series of interviews with some of our favorite Black girl actors. Never before released, check out Aurelia's conversation with actor and internet personality Andrea Lewis, whom you might remember from her awesome web series Black Actress, as well as her work on Degrassi: The Next Generation. They talk about getting started as a child actor, what its like being the only Black girl on set, Vine stars, and why "if you want to see yourself, you have to create your own art" isn't *always* the best idea.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 54: THE RECAP
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: 2015 is done, fam. We discuss our favorite BGT moments from 2015, speak our plans for 2016 into existence and whole lot more. *DJ Khaled voice* IT'S A VIBE.

episodes.title: BGT EPISODE 53: Bluetooths & Bodies
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're all back!  Join us as we discuss The Wiz Live! (BLACK EXCELLENCE AND ILLUSION MESH), Creed (BAEWATCH) and what's sure to be the highlight of 2016: Barbershop 3. Then it's on to the main event: Bodies! Ours to be specific. We get super personal and discuss everything including loves and insecurities, plastic surgery, how our body image has been shaped by our cultures and/or outside influences and why we should all be talking about our bodies all the time because it's totally normal to have a body. This is a very therapeutic and restorative episode, y'all. Trigger Warning for mild dieting and ED talk

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Episode #9: Master of None
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
We give our thoughts on Master of None, diversity in casting and decolonizing your bedroom. And biscuits.

Head over to blackgirlstalking.tumblr.com for links to all articles discussed.

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Episode: Nerd Files
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
In honor of the new season debuting in January, Aurelia and Fatima are on nerd duty this week, discussing all things X-Files, including its stellar trench coat game; why the only black people on it were ghosts, ghouls and goblins; why modern day Scully is probably thriving and Mulder is probably broke due to financial domination; some of their fave episodes and what they'd like to see this time around.

X-Files theme remix used in this epsiode can be found here https://soundcloud.com/majorleaguewobs/illuminati-theme-trap-remix

episodes.title: BGT Episode 52: America's Next Top Pyramid Scheme
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're taking a stroll down America's Next Top Model lane. We discuss ANTM's cancellation after a 50 year run, our fave moments and shady ass world of Tyra Banks. But before we get into the Rushcard of supermodels, of course we have to discuss the best video of 2015: HOTLINE BLING. Shout out to our sponsors Throwboy and Blue Apron for hooking our listeners up with some sweet (and tasty) deals. ENJOY!

episodes.title: BGT EPISODE 51: BGT'S FAVORITE THIIIIIIIINGS!
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're taking a break from current events and all related messiness in favor of some much needed US time. Join us as we each discuss 3 things that we are loving at the moment from face masks to crystals to HAMILTON and the return of Janet Jackson. If we had the juice like Oprah you would totally be getting free Hamilton tickets with this episode!

episodes.title: BGT Episode 50: Nobody Puts B̶a̶b̶y̶ Cookie in a  ̶C̶o̶r̶n̶e̶r Cage
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're talking cannibals (Empire), excellence (Viola Davis), mediocre stalker films (The Perfect Guy) and answering some listener questions.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 49: Tami Winfrey Harris
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're excited to be joined by Tami Winfrey Harris, author of The Sisters Are Alright: Changing the Broken Narrative of Black Women in America! Join us as we delve into Tami's book and chat about her inspiration, respectability politics, reality tv and wonder when baby oiled up Steve Harvey is going to slide off of the earth. Stay tuned to the end for a special giveaway!

episodes.title: BGT Episode 48: The Serena Beat w/Britt Julious and Kyrell Grant
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
We’re talking all things Serena! We discuss Serena dominating life on and of the court, the teachings her father installed in both her and Venus as children while wondering how prepared you can really be for racism and, yeah, making out with Drake over porterhouse steaks (this is BGT, y’all). 

LIVING HER BEST LIFE


References:

Video of Baby Venus
The Meaning of Serena Williams by Claudia Rankine
Serena and Aubrey 4EVR

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Ep #7: DRAKEWATCH
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In this extra special #DRAKEWATCH, Alesia is joined by Senior Drake Correspondent Kyrell Grant and Michelle Ofiwe. We discuss Champagne’s recent feud with Meek Mill (is Drake a bully???), the post-Meek backlash (why???) and of course Queen Nicki. Michelle also gives us some background on her amazing piece, Are We Witnessing the Return of the Hip Hop Girlfriend and we all wonder what’s so bad about being soft? #TEAMVULNERABILTY

episodes.title: BGT Episode 47: Magic Mike 2: Sisterhood of the Traveling Thongs
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: It's all about clapbacks and ass claps this week as we discuss Nicki (yay), Taylor (nah) and Magic Mike XXL.

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Ep #6: Tinder & #TMI With Dear Kate’s Julie Sygiel
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
In this episode, Aurelia and Ramou chat with Dear Kate's founder Julie Sygiel about why being a good ally is just good business, the hassles and hilarity of online dating, and surfing the crimson wave. 

This special ep is part of a larger package of content with Dear Kate and BGT, so make sure to listen to the full ep, and peep below for more info:

GIVEAWAY:
Listen to the whole episode for info on how to win a pair of Dear Kates, and make sure to follow @blkgirlstalking and @dearkates on twitter!

PROMO CODE:
www.dearkates.com 
Enter the code "blackgirlstalking" at checkout for 25% off your first Dear Kate purchase!

And make sure to swing by www.blackgirlstalking.com this week for more exclusive content with some of our favorite Dear Kate models!

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Episode #5: On Art Feelings and Feeling Art
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Fatima chats with Iman Xashi of the Blanguage podcast, and Rianna Jade Parker and Kareem Reid of the Lonely Londoners collective about art, podcasting, the blessings bestowed upon us by Cecile Emeke and more.

episodes.title: BGT Epsiode 46: Rachel Constructs: The Mystery of the Spokane Shapeshifter
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Join us as we weigh in on the Iggy Azalea of the Pacific Northwest, Rachel Dolezal; discuss season 3 of Orange is the New Black, and the lonely sociopaths who occupy the Games of Thrones writing room; and then wash all the horror away as we give all the glory to Janet Jackson.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 45: WE TALKING BOUT PRAXIS, NOT A GAME. PRAXIS - On Girlhood and Solidarity
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Fanta Sylla joins us this week to talk about the film Girlhood and her recent essay on solidarity between black women and non-black women of color. Plus, we all bow down to the rightful queens of our hearts, A-listers, paid sisters: Beynika

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Ep #4: Behind The Scandalabra (Aurelia chats with Jasika Nicole)
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Aurelia chats with special guest Jasika Nicole; who you may remember from the hit TV shows Fringe and Scandal (our livetweet fave), among many other great projects. In this ep the ladies chat about following your dreams even when they don't quite look like what you thought, getting by on a Chili's paycheck, ethical consumerism, how to cosplay consciously, and the importance of not faking the funk just to land a gig (aka "if a tree falls in a bodega and no one is around to hear it...will the cashier still think I'm Puerto Rican?").

episodes.title: BGT Episode 44: Black Girls Traveling & #BEAUTYCHAT pt. 2
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
To say that things have been tough lately is an understatement* so this episode we're in full on self care mode! CFBG aficionado Jamala Johns joins us for a fun discussion on traveling, in which we discuss our favorite locations, budgeting, safety and BLUTOPIA (Black Girl Utopia - let's make it happen??). We also follow up on our first #BEAUTYCHAT with updates and new faves. Look out for more lists and a fun challenge! 

*Please continue to follow us on tumblr and Twitter for updates on current events. Stay safe and spread love

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Ep #3: Inside The #Blacktor’s Studio (Aurelia chats with Reagan Gomez)
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Aurelia chats with special guest Reagan Gomez; star of The Parent 'Hood, The Cleveland Show, and her very own web series Almost Home, about being the only Black face in a white performance space, accountability in the age of the hashtag, LL Cool J: Sitcom Star and, the realities of being a Black actor in a post UPN world.

episodes.title: BGT EPISODE 43:  Everything Happens So Much
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: EMPIRE! EMPIRE! EMPIRE! That finale was bananas and we try our best to break it down. We also tackle the conundrum that is The Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, cross our fingers that Zayn Malik (#ZAYNWATCH) is on his way to becoming the Muslim Usher, answer a few listener questions, which quickly turns from a black girl love fest to thirst, and mooooore!

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Ep #2: Alesia and Val talk about KENDRICK
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Alesia and special guest Val get together to chat about Kendrick Lamar, respectability politics, Kanye West and everything in between. We also address Alesia's auntie tendencies. Enjoy!

episodes.title: BGT Episode 42: How Your Granny May Have Gotten Away with Murder
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In this episode we answer your #AskBGT questions, decide all the Sex and the City characters were The Worst, discuss the escalating greatness of Empire, and recap the How to Get Away with Murder finale and Annalise's trill as fuck momma.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 41
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're back just in time to delve into all the glorious happenings during #clapbackweek: Amber Rose getting Khloe K together without breaking a sweat; Jessica Williams telling everyone to lean all the way out and into several seats; #Drakewatch and more.

episodes.title: BGT Bonus Episode: Ramou Talks With Alexis Wilkinson
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
BGT is always thinking of ways to introduce new and exciting content to our listeners. One of our ideas was to bring you more intimate one-on-one conversations with some of our favorite people. 

In this bonus episode I had a great conversation with Alexis Wilkinson right on the heels of her tenure as Harvard Lampoon president. 

I hope you enjoy it as much as I did!

- Ramou

episodes.title: BGT Episode 40
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're back from our hiatus and this week we're talking about the return of Broad City; Kendrick Lamar's Billboard interview; the Oscars keeping it white; the glorious mess that is Empire and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 39: 2014 Roundup
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Writer Pilot Viruet joins us for our last episode of 2014 as we look back on some of our favorite pop culture moments of the year.

episodes.title: BGT Extras
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In case you didn't get enough of us this week, here are some outtakes that didn't make it into our latest episode. In them we talk about the Bill Cosby rape allegations and the fallout; Halle Berry: Black Mom; Blue Ivy: the one baby to rule them all; and Alesia talks to us about seeing Beyond the Lights.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 38 with Janet Mock
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We were so honored to be able to come together with Janet Mock for this episode to talk about a whole host of things including exceptionalism and respectability politics; disagreeing with feminist elders; creating community in online spaces; allies getting involved in the fight for the rights of trans people; self-care and more! Janet is so lovely and we were (and still are!) thrilled that we got to share space with her in this moment.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 37
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
This week we're talking Azealia Banks' killer new album; Beyonce’s re-release; #DrakeWatch; Eminem's ol tired ass; the Serial podcast taking over our lives, Kim K doing Kim K and 
Gabby Union addressing nude photo leaks.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 36
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Super long episode this week in which we talk about street harassment, trash bag men, Marvel news, Dear White People and more, plus, we share our self-care practices and regimens.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 35: Reagan Gomez, All Shonda Everything, and MORE
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary:
Black Girls Talking #35: Reagan Gomez, All Shonda Everything, and MORE
 
We're briefly joined by Reagan Gomez who gives us the details on her awesome and much needed webseries. Then it's onto the discussion which includes the return of Shonda Thursdays (obviously), our new love "How to Get Away With Murder (obviously), Scandal, and Queen Viola's ***flawless response to that terrible, awful NYT piece. Speaking of news outlets, we discuss the current state of diversity (in some cases lack thereof) at the New York Times, Buzzfeed, Jezebel, and our high hopes for Roxane Gay's new gig, The Butter. Other topics include National Hero: Charlo Greene, Ramou's Best Night Ever featuring OPRAH, and a few listener letters (warning: don't start none won't be none).
 
References
 
Surviving The Dead
Viola Davis Responds to Being Called 'Less Classically Beautiful': 'You Define You', The Root
Latina, at the white, male New York Times: “Why are people thinking it’s OK to say racist sh-t in front of me?”, Salon
What We’re Doing To Keep Building A Diverse Editorial Operation, Buzzfeed
Introducing Three New Jezebel Staffers
Introducing The Butter: Roxane Gay Is Coming To Stay With Us, The Toast
Melissa Harris Perry's Black Feminism Syllabus
#SWOONSTEP

episodes.title: BGT Episode 34 with guest Chara Lauriston
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Writer and performer Charla Lauriston came through this episode to hang out and talk about everything and nothing. If you haven't watched her excellent web series Clench  Release, you've probably wasted 3/4 of your life, so do something about that.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 34 with guest Charla Lauriston
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Writer and performer Charla Lauriston came through this episode to hang out and talk about everything and nothing. If you haven't watched her excellent web series Clench & Release, you've probably wasted 3/4 of your life, so do something about that.

episodes.title: BGT Style Roundtable
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We were thrilled to be asked to be a part of the new book Women in Clothes (out today!), which features stories, essays, discussions, pictures and testimonials from over 600 women on the ways in which clothes and style shape and represent them. The book features an excerpt from our own conversation on these issues, as well as our individual style surveys, but you can listen to the full audio of our chat right here. Women in Clothes is filled to the brim with so many wonderful women, we hope you'll go out and buy a copy!

episodes.title: BGT Episode 33
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we discuss what’s been happening in Ferguson, MO, Nicki Minaj’s Anaconda video, Taylor Swift fatigue, comic book movies and more.

episodes.title: Black Girls Talking Episode 32
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We were delighted to have writer Bim Adewunmi join us for this episode to talk about the cringeworthy Straight Outta Compton casting call; Emmy nominations; Nurse Jackie and women anti-heroes; her Guardian cover story on Assata Shakur and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 31
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we talk the return of OINB (spoilers galore); Lupita in Vogue; Kanye and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 30
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Join us this week as we discuss the lasting impact of the late, great Dr. Maya Angelou; #YesAllWomen; Lupita Nyong'o doing big things; Laverne Cox on the cover of Time; Louis C.K. and Justin Bieber.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 29
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we're talking Solange mollywhopping Jay Z, bell hooks going in on Beyonce, Kim Kardashian being tardy for the party, V. Stiviano and Donald Sterling, and the Jem and the Holograms movie casting news.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 28
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: One of our favorite people, Danielle Henderson is back to talk to us about the insanity of this season's Scandal as well as part 1 of the RHOA Reunion, plus we get into what went down on Mad Men and Game of Thrones this week and answer a listener question about the BGT origin story.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 27 with guest Aisha Muharrar
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Writer Aisha Muharrar (of Parks and Recreation) joins us for a chat about #StandWithJamilah, I, Too, Am Harvard, Alexis Wilkinson, Magic Mike XXL, diversity on TV and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 26: Carefree Black Girls
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we've got delightful guest Jamala Johns joining us to talk Lupita, Lena Dunham and Girls, and Carefree Black Girls.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 25: Oscars
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we're talking Oscars, Lupita (of course), the return of Scandal, Shonda holding it down for all of us, and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 24: Award Season
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're back from our holiday break with episode 24 and in it we're joined by blogger Kara Brown of yoimjustsayin.com to talk Lupita Nyong'o and the Golden Globes, Kanye allegedly punching somebody in the face, Mindy Kaling's NAACP Image Award nomination and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 23: Beyoncé
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In our last episode of 2013, we're talking Rashida Jones, Janelle Monae's Grammy snub, SNL's secret audition for black women, Golden Globe nominations, and we end with the Queen, Beyonce who graced us all with a surprise to wrap up the year. We're on hiatus until early January, but you can still talk to us on Twitter and contribute to our Gofundme campaign. Happy holidays and see you in a few weeks!

episodes.title: BGT Episode 22
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we're talking about the 'race-themed' classic known as The Best Man Holiday; last week's episode of Scandal (trigger warning for discussion of sexual assault); Kanye West; and Lily Allen's new video, but we first kick things off by giving shout outs to some of those who have contributed to our GoFundMe campaign. If you contributed  but didn’t hear your name mentioned, it’s only because we are doing a few shout outs each episode, not because we forgot you!

episodes.title: BGT Episode 21: 12 Years a Slave and Kerry Washington on SNL
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we kick things off talking about Kerry Washington's turn hosting SNL and then jump into a larger discussion of diversity on SNL; later, we get into our impressions of director Steve McQueen's latest offering: "12 Years a Slave." ***SPOILER ALERT for 12 Years a Slave.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 20: TV Landscape
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we're in the land of television, where we discuss Scandal's glorious return; how Parks & Recreation and The Mindy Project are failing in the representation department; and how new kids on the block Brooklyn Nine-Nine and Sleepy Hollow are getting it right.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 19: Pop Culture Roundup
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we kick things off with a discussion about comedians, starting with Dave Chappelle's performance in Hartford, Connecticut, followed by Aziz Ansari's take on lazy racist jokes during Comedy Central's roast of James Franco, and Eddie Murphy's new single with Snoop Lion. We also discuss director Steve McQueen's appearance at the Toronto International Film Festival's press conference for 12 Years a Slave; Operation Catsuit; what we’re looking forward to for the fall TV season; and Ramou and Fatima talk about their essays: Finding Solace in Comedy and the Search for Long Luxurious Blonde Hair and Willow Smith, and the Curious Case of the Carefree Black Girl, posted on blackgirlstalking.com

episodes.title: BGT Episode 18: Writer and Filmmaker Lena Waithe
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we're joined by writer and filmmaker Lena Waithe for an inspiring chat about the new black cinema; representation; defining blackness; and her current projects: Dear White People and Twenties.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 17: WoC Creatives, with guest Britt Julious
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: For episode 17 we're joined by writer Britt Julious for a chat about women of color in creative fields, her work surrounding #BlackGirlFeels and her hometown of Chicago; the culture of livetweeting TV shows; MTV's Catfish; ABC Family's Twisted and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 16: Emmy Nominations, Spike Lee Kickstarter, Orange is the New Black
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: This week we talk about the Zimmerman verdict and Juror B37's collapsed book deal, Emmy nominations, Spike Lee's Kickstarter campaign, Netflix's latest offering: Orange is the New Black, Rae Dawn Chong coming for Oprah, and share who some of our favorite anti-hero women characters are.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 15: Dark Girls and Oprah's Next Chapter: African-American Women in Hollywood
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In this episode we discuss Paula Deen's adventures in racism; Miley Cyrus and Amanda Bynes' white girl struggles; review the documentary Dark Girls, as well as Oprah's Next Chapter: African-American Women in Hollywood, and get into the issue of representation in the magazine industry.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 14: Black Hair and PoC Creating Content
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We’ve got a packed show this week! We discuss our impressions of the You Can Touch My Hair exhibit, Issa Rae playing Nina Simone and Amanda Bynes’ issues with black women. Plus, we talk about the depressing state of roles for people of color, Ramou gives us an overview of her newly completed thesis (YAY!!) and we solve the mystery of Mad Men’s Bob Benson.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 13: Ask Black Girls Talking
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We’re back! In this episode we’re answering your burning questions, talking about Angelina Jolie, loneliness, toxic people, catcalling and then some.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 12: Reality TV
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: All around delightful guest, and Season 9 (New Orleans) The Real World alumna, Melissa Beck joins us this week as we talk about representation and reality television; discuss Brad Paisley and LL Cool J as the new Hip Hop Dalmatians; crack up over Justin Timberlake losing his perm in real time; collectively side eye Rick Ross, Talib Kweli and ASAP Rocky, and despair over the nightmare that is dating.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 11: Hello Cupid and Dating
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Join us for episode 11 as we talk about Black & Sexy TV's new web series, Hello Cupid and share some of our own dating experiences, but first we break down what's hot in the streets.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 10: 90s Black Movie Rewatch
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Join the BGT crew this week as we praise and side-eye four classic 90s Black movies: Love Jones, Love & Basketball, The Best Man and Brown Sugar. But first, we get into what's hot in the streets: Justin Timberlake and his relaxer returning to SNL, Kanye needing an Iyanla Vanzant hug, Top 10 white boy lists, Law & Order: SVU's after school special episode on Chris Brown and Rihanna, and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 9: Feminism and Black Womanhood
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Group therapy is definitely in session this week as we're joined by special (and delightful!) guests, Danielle and Pam for an extra long discussion about Black womanhood and feminism.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 8: Grammy Awards
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We're recapping the Grammy Awards: Frank 'Richie Tenenbaum' Ocean, Jay-Z being too rich to give a damn, Justin Timberlake's trip to the hair salon and Prince being Prince. Plus we talk about white people struggle dancing; hear from senior Bieber correspondent, Ramou; give props to Jeopardy! Teen Tournament and all-around life champion, Leonard Cooper; talk about our love for SistaTV and more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 7: Yelling to the Sky, Some Girls
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Join us this week as we briefly review Victoria Mahoney's 'Yelling to the Sky' and the BBC Three series 'Some Girls,' but first we check in with the Michelle Obama and Beyoncé haters; SNL and Lena Dunham's lazy, racist joke-telling; Hannah's white feminist moment on 'Girls'; Gabourey Sidibe and typecasting, and whatever else is hot out here in these streets.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 6: Django Unchained
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: We’re back! Join us for our first episode of 2013 as we review Django Unchained but first, we talk about white feminists coming for Beyoncé, Solange putting music journalists on blast, Quvenzhané Wallis' Oscar nomination, and answer a few questions from our listeners.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 5: 2012 Roundup
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: Join us for our last episode of the year as we recap some highs and lows of 2012! We get into our love for Scandal; the mess that was The Help; Mad Men’s invisible Black character named Dawn; Steve Harvey and his intimate relationship with baby oil; Issa Rae: Boss Lady, how Willow Smith is better than all of us and a whole lot more.

episodes.title: BGT Episode 4, Part 2: Cultural Appropriation
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In this second half of our discussion on cultural appropriation, we touch on MIA, Azealia Banks, Solange and intra-PoC cultural appropriation; wearily get into Lana Del Rey’s incessant nonsense; talk about white rappers who aren’t a complete mess and we all stand in solidarity with Ramou as she discusses her beef with Macklemore.

episodes.title: Black Girls Talking Ep 4 pt 1: Cultural Appropriation
episodes.author: Black Girls Talking
episodes.summary: In Part 1 of this two-part episode, we discuss the trailer for season 2 of Girls, starring Lena Dunham's only Black friend: Gambino; Kreayshawn's Black person costume; historical hot mess, Gwen Stefani; Florida swamp-flavored cultural appropriator, Diplo and much more. Before you think about doing an acoustic cover of Bandz A Make Her Dance, you should pause and listen to this.
